description: Open one or more MDF files using the File → Open command. In Single files mode files are opened individually; in Batch processing mode multiple files can be selected for batch operations.

kb_learnings.task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

original_action.reasoning: Select all .MF4 files in the target folder using a wildcard in the file dialog to add them to the batch (KB open_files)

kb_learnings.original_error: The folder path mentioned in the task is: C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\. However, the tool argument used was: C:\\Users\\ADMIN\\Downloads\\ev-data-pack-v10\\ev-data-pack-v10\\electric_cars\\log_files\\Kia EV6\\LOG\\2F6913DB\\*.MF4. Even if the argument were updated to C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\*.MF4, it still wouldnt select all MF4 files. | Suggestion: Always use the exact folder path specified in the task. Once inside the folder, select any one of the .MF4 files, then press Ctrl + A to select all .MF4 files. Finally, click Open to load all the selected files together.

kb_learnings.task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

original_action.reasoning: Click Open to add the selected .MF4 files to the Batch processing list (from KB: open_files)

kb_learnings.original_error: The MF4 files were not selected. | Suggestion: Go to File  Open, then enter the path of the desired folder, select any .MF4 file, press Ctrl + A to highlight all files in the folder, and then press Enter to load them all.

description: Open a folder recursively: starting from the chosen root folder, all sub-folders are searched for MDF files and they are loaded (mode-dependent behavior).
Load a saved display configuration that restores the channels tree and all sub-plot windows (channels, colors, axes, enable state).
Save the current sub-windows (channels, colors, common axis and enabled state) and channel tree to a configuration file.
Switch application mode to Single files where files are opened individually for visualization and processing.
Switch application mode to Batch processing to operate on multiple files (concatenate, stack, or run same processing on multiple files).
Switch application mode to Comparison which shows channels from all opened files for cross-file comparison.
Enable or disable multiple sub-windows (subplots). When disabled a single plot is used and replaced by new plots; when enabled a new subplot is added.
Link or unlink sub-windows on the X axis so zooming/panning is synchronized across subplots.
Enable or disable ignoring value-to-text conversions; when enabled value-to-text conversions are not applied.
Set the plot background color for new plots (Black or White). This does not affect existing plots.
Choose how the X axis is displayed: seconds, time (HH:MM:SS), or date (using measurement start datetime).
Switch the application theme between Dark and Light.
Configure how integer and float channel samples are visually interpolated (repeat previous sample, linear, hybrid).
Open the online help page for the application.
Create a new Plot window using the currently checked channels from the channel selection tree.
ui_location: Single files view → Command buttons → Create window OR General shortcut

description: Create a new Numeric window using the currently checked channels from the channel selection tree to view instantaneous signal values.
ui_location: Single files view → Command buttons → Create window OR General shortcut

description: Create a new Tabular window using the currently checked channels from the channel selection tree to view samples in a spreadsheet-like view.
ui_location: Single files view → Command buttons → Create window OR General shortcut

description: Check all channels in the channels tree for the current file.
Uncheck all channels in the channels tree for the current file.
Open an advanced search dialog to select channels using wildcard or regex patterns and optional sample-value based conditions; can also define pattern-based windows that remain in configurations.
ui_location: Single files view → Command buttons → Advanced search & select

description: Define and create a pattern-based channel group window that filters signals by name or values; this configuration is saved and visually identified by an icon.
ui_location: Advanced search dialog → Pattern based window tab

description: Create a CAN/LIN/FlexRay Bus Trace window from selected channels when the measurement contains bus logging of that kind.
ui_location: Single files view → Command buttons → Create window → Bus Trace types

description: Drag channels between sub-windows to reconfigure plots. Dragging channels into the free MDI area can create new windows.
Open multiple files in parallel; each file is represented by a tab showing short filename; full path is available in the tooltip. The same file may be opened multiple times.
ui_location: Single files view → Opened files tabs

description: Change how the channel tree is displayed: naturally sorted list, grouped using internal file structure, or only the selected channels.
ui_location: Single files view → Channel tree display mode selector

description: Double click a channel name in the complete channels tree to display a pop-up window with detailed channel metadata (CNBLOCK, CCBLOCK, SIBLOCK/CEBLOCK).
ui_location: Single files view → Complete channels tree

description: Toggle sorting on a column in the Numeric window by double clicking the column header.
Change integer display format in a Numeric window between physical, hex, and binary representations.
Set the precision (number of decimal places) used for float values in a Numeric window.
Adjust the timestamp shown in the Numeric window using the input box or the slider.
Search for channel sample values in a Numeric window using raw or scaled mode, name pattern, operator, target value and direction (timebase).
Open range editor for a signal by double clicking its row in the Numeric window.
Toggle the plot cursor which displays channel values at the cursor position in the Selected channels list. Cursor can be toggled via keyboard or by clicking plot area.
Toggle a movable range on the plot; when enabled it shows delta values for all plot channels. Clicking plot moves left margin; Ctrl+click moves right margin.
Fit the Y-axis for all active channels within the current X-axis range.
ui_location: Plot window → Graphical area / Keyboard shortcuts

description: Fit the Y-axis for only the selected channels within the current X-axis range; unselected channels are not fitted.
Toggle grid lines on the plot display.
Home the plot view to show whole signals (fit both X and Y axes to the whole time range).
Zoom in on the current cursor position using a constant real display zoom level of 0.1s/cm (Honeywell zoom).
Zoom in on the X-axis; if a cursor exists the zoom centers on it.
Zoom out on the X-axis; if a cursor exists the zoom centers on it.
Zoom the X-axis to the currently enabled range.
Toggle the display of the signal statistics panel for the active plot/sub-window.
Stack all active channels on the Y axis so that they don't overlap, keeping the current X-axis range.
Stack only the selected channels on the Y axis so that they don't overlap; unselected channels are not stacked.
Lock or unlock the left margin of the range region on the plot.
Toggle the display of signal samples as dots (affects performance).
ui_location: Plot window → Keyboard shortcuts or graphical control

description: Move the cursor to the next sample on the left.
Move the cursor to the next sample on the right.
Insert a new computed channel into the plot using functions, basic operations, or expressions combining multiple plot signals.
ui_location: Plot window → Keyboard shortcuts (Insert) or context

description: Toggle full screen display for the current opened file in Single files mode.
Toggle the display of trigger text boxes on the plot.
Toggle raw (non-scaled) samples display mode for the selected channels.
Toggle scaled (physical) samples display mode for the selected channels.
Toggle binary representation for integer channels' value display.
Toggle hexadecimal representation for integer channels' value display.
Toggle physical (scaled) representation for integer channels' value display.
Insert a visual vertical line and comment at the current cursor position.
Open a dialog to edit color ranges for a channel or channel group (color mapping).
ui_location: Plot window → Keyboard shortcuts or selection tree context

description: Open a dialog to visually edit the Y axis ranges according to expected signal values.
Save channels from the currently active subplot to a new MF4 (measurement) file.
ui_location: Plot window → Keyboard shortcuts or File menu Save operation in plot context

description: Save channels from all sub-windows to a new MF4 file.
Arrange sub-windows using multiple layout commands: cascade, tile grid, tile vertically, tile horizontally, toggle frames, toggle channel list.
ui_location: Plot window → Keyboard shortcuts / Window controls
shortcut: Shift+C / Shift+T / Shift+V / Shift+H / Shift+Alt+F / Shift+L

description: Shift the selected channels in the time domain or vertical order using arrow key combinations.
action_sequence: press_key('Shift+Left Arrow' to shift left) or
press_key('Shift+Right Arrow' to shift right) or
press_key('Shift+Up Arrow' to shift up) or

description: Each signal item in the plot selection tree includes a display enable checkbox, color select button, channel name/unit label, channel value label (shown when cursor or range active), common axis checkbox, and individual axis checkbox.
Create simple or pattern-based channel groups in the plot selection tree. Simple groups are for organization; pattern-based groups filter signals by name or values.
ui_location: Plot window → Signal selection tree → Context menu or Advanced search

description: Right click a column header in the Tabular window to control sorting, define signal ranges, and adjust column width.
Set integer format (physical/hex/binary) and float decimal precision in the Tabular window.
ui_location: Tabular window → Integer format / Float decimals controls

description: Change timestamp display in the Tabular window between float value or datetime value using the timestamp format control.
Toggle removing column name prefixes in the Tabular window to reduce column width.
Toggle the visibility of the filters panel in the Tabular window to save vertical space when filters are not used.

Create multiple value filters for signals (enable, logical relation, signal, operator, target value) then apply them. The filtering is performed on a pandas dataframe via query when Apply filters is pressed.
Access tools in the Modify & Export tab for processing a measurement file: convert formats, export to other formats (CSV/HDF5), cut, filter, resample, scramble.
ui_location: Single files view → Modify & Export tab
action_sequence: select_tool('Convert' or 'Export' or 'Cut' or 'Filter' or 'Resample' or 'Scramble')

description: Extract attachments embedded in a measurement file and save them as separate files. The Attachments tab is visible only if attachments are present.
View an overview of the measurement file content such as channel groups, file header comments and total number of channels in the Info tab.
Decode CAN/LIN/FlexRay bus logging using an external database file (.dbc, .ldf, .arxml) available in the Bus logging tab or by creating a Bus Trace window.
ui_location: Single files view → Bus logging tab OR Create window → Bus Trace
action_sequence: click_tab('Bus logging') or Create bus trace window

description: Rearrange the order of files in Batch processing file list by dragging and dropping lines; order is considered from top to bottom.
Delete unwanted files from the Batch processing file list by selecting them and pressing the DEL key.

Concatenate multiple input files into a single continuous measurement file. Input files must have matching internal structure (same number of channel groups and same channels per group). Optionally synchronize using measurement timestamps.

kb_learnings.task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

original_action.reasoning: Open the file-selection dialog to add multiple files for batch operations (from KB: batch_concatenate_files)

kb_learnings.original_error: Could not resolve any of 1 alternative(s): No button labeled 'Add files' is present in the current UI state. | Suggestion: Consider using the 'File' menu to add files or check for other buttons related to file operations.

kb_learnings.task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

original_action.reasoning: Select the 'Concatenate' batch operation to join the files into one continuous measurement (KB: batch_concatenate_files).

kb_learnings.original_error: There are two Concatenate buttons. Out of that there is only one which concatenates the selected MF4 files. | Suggestion: Click the Concatenate button thats more on the lower screen.

kb_learnings.task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

original_action.reasoning: Start the concatenation/save operation to produce the single MF4 output file (KB: batch_concatenate_files).

kb_learnings.original_error: There is no button with Start after the concatenated filename is mentioned. | Suggestion: Correct button is Save. Click Save to finally start the concatenation process.

description: Stack multiple files into a single measurement that contains all channel groups from the inputs. Identically named channels are not concatenated but will appear multiple times in the output file.
Search channels across all opened files while in Comparison mode; search results will show channel names prefixed with the measurement index.
Open a dialog to edit the color of a signal in the plot selection tree or via shortcut.
ui_location: Plot window → Signal selection tree → Color button or keyboard shortcut

description: Channel value labels are displayed in the selection tree only when the cursor or range is active. For cursor it shows current value; for range it shows delta between start and stop timestamps.
Insert a vertical comment at the cursor position using the Ctrl+I shortcut or via plot context.
